thread.title: Weep Not for the Decline of The Heavily Polluting Horse

author: wsjcom
title: Weep Not for the Decline of The Heavily Polluting Horse
text:
Gregory Curtis’s review of “Farewell to the Horse” by Ulrich Raulff (Books, Feb. 10) notes that, among the many benefits conferred by the horse, in 1900 New York City’s 130,000 horses daily deposited 1,100 tons of manure and 71,000 gallons of urine in the streets. Mr. Curtis notes in passing the stench that much horse waste created.
That reminded me of something my mother, who was born in Chicago in 1918, said to me during the 1970s, when the environmental movement was getting started. “Air pollution,” she exclaimed. “You...
